intro: Melissitus linczevskii, commonly known as the Linczevsky's melissitus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
